alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 12:39PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Otero County through 115 PM MDT... At 1239 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Elk, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mayhill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
